member.name: T:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum
member.summary:
The NLDelaySum class provides a CLS compliant, MWArray interface to the M-functions contained in the files:
C:\Projects\ESME Deliverables\Utilities\bellhopNL\NL_delaysum.m
C:\Projects\ESME Deliverables\Utilities\bellhopNL\read_arrivals_bin.m
C:\Projects\ESME Deliverables\Utilities\bellhopNL\ts_arons.m
C:\Projects\ESME Deliverables\Utilities\bellhopNL\ts_chapman.m
deployprint.m
printdlg.m
member.remarks: @Version 4.0

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.#cctor
member.summary: The static constructor instantiates and initializes the MATLAB Compiler Runtime instance.

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the NLDelaySum class.

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.Finalize
member.summary: Class destructor called by the CLR garbage collector.

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.Dispose
member.summary: Frees the native resources associated with this object

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal dispose function

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.NL_delaysum
member.summary: Provides a single output, 0-input MWArrayinterface to the NL_delaysum M-function.
member.remarks: M-Documentation: NL_DELAYSUM - Incorporates nonlinear effects using similitude equations Usage: rtsmat = NL_delaysum(ARRFIL, z, w, fs, T, model) Inputs: ARRFIL - string containing name of (binary) BELLHOP arrivals file z - charge depth (meters) w - charge weight (kilograms) fs - sample rate for output (Hz) T - total duration of output waveform (seconds) model - similitude time series model (either: 'arons' or 'chapman') Output: rtsmat - matrix of received time series samples (one column for each rcv) rr - receiver ranges rd - receiver depths Based on delaysum from the Acoustics Toolbox, which computes the receiver time series by summing up the echoes in the waveguide based on the amplitude and delay of each echo. Modified by J. Peterson to account for the nonlinear effects via similitude formulas. He also added the Arons formula for the explosive waveform Further work by L. Henderson fixing an issue due to the fact that the Hilbert transform is non-causal, i.e. starts before the original waveform $Id: $
member.returns: An MWArray containing the first output argument.

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.NL_delaysum(MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray)
member.summary: Provides a single output, 1-input MWArrayinterface to the NL_delaysum M-function.
member.remarks: M-Documentation: NL_DELAYSUM - Incorporates nonlinear effects using similitude equations Usage: rtsmat = NL_delaysum(ARRFIL, z, w, fs, T, model) Inputs: ARRFIL - string containing name of (binary) BELLHOP arrivals file z - charge depth (meters) w - charge weight (kilograms) fs - sample rate for output (Hz) T - total duration of output waveform (seconds) model - similitude time series model (either: 'arons' or 'chapman') Output: rtsmat - matrix of received time series samples (one column for each rcv) rr - receiver ranges rd - receiver depths Based on delaysum from the Acoustics Toolbox, which computes the receiver time series by summing up the echoes in the waveguide based on the amplitude and delay of each echo. Modified by J. Peterson to account for the nonlinear effects via similitude formulas. He also added the Arons formula for the explosive waveform Further work by L. Henderson fixing an issue due to the fact that the Hilbert transform is non-causal, i.e. starts before the original waveform $Id: $
member.returns: An MWArray containing the first output argument.

Modified by J. Peterson to account for the nonlinear effects via similitude formulas. He also added the Arons formula for the explosive waveform Further work by L. Henderson fixing an issue due to the fact that the Hilbert transform is non-causal, i.e. starts before the original waveform $Id: $

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.NL_delaysum(System.Int32,MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray[]@,MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray[])
member.summary: Provides an interface for the NL_delaysum function in which the input and output arguments are specified as an array of MWArrays.
member.remarks: This method will allocate and return by reference the output argument array. M-Documentation: NL_DELAYSUM - Incorporates nonlinear effects using similitude equations Usage: rtsmat = NL_delaysum(ARRFIL, z, w, fs, T, model) Inputs: ARRFIL - string containing name of (binary) BELLHOP arrivals file z - charge depth (meters) w - charge weight (kilograms) fs - sample rate for output (Hz) T - total duration of output waveform (seconds) model - similitude time series model (either: 'arons' or 'chapman') Output: rtsmat - matrix of received time series samples (one column for each rcv) rr - receiver ranges rd - receiver depths Based on delaysum from the Acoustics Toolbox, which computes the receiver time series by summing up the echoes in the waveguide based on the amplitude and delay of each echo. Modified by J. Peterson to account for the nonlinear effects via similitude formulas. He also added the Arons formula for the explosive waveform Further work by L. Henderson fixing an issue due to the fact that the Hilbert transform is non-causal, i.e. starts before the original waveform $Id: $
member.param: The number of output arguments to return

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.read_arrivals_bin
member.summary: Provides a single output, 0-input MWArrayinterface to the read_arrivals_bin M-function.
member.remarks: M-Documentation: Read the arrival time/amplitude data computed by BELLHOP usage: [ Arr, Pos ] = read_arrivals_bin( ARRFile, Narrmx ); Arr is a structure containing all the arrivals information Pos is a structure containing the positions of source and receivers ARRFile is the name of the Arrivals File Narrmx is the maximum number of arrivals allowed mbp 9/96
member.returns: An MWArray containing the first output argument.

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.read_arrivals_bin(MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray)
member.summary: Provides a single output, 1-input MWArrayinterface to the read_arrivals_bin M-function.
member.remarks: M-Documentation: Read the arrival time/amplitude data computed by BELLHOP usage: [ Arr, Pos ] = read_arrivals_bin( ARRFile, Narrmx ); Arr is a structure containing all the arrivals information Pos is a structure containing the positions of source and receivers ARRFile is the name of the Arrivals File Narrmx is the maximum number of arrivals allowed mbp 9/96
member.returns: An MWArray containing the first output argument.

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.ts_arons
member.summary: Provides a single output, 0-input MWArrayinterface to the ts_arons M-function.
member.remarks: M-Documentation: TS_ARONS - compute the time history of an explosives generated shock wave Calling sequence: Inputs: z - charge depth in m w - charge weight in kg R - range in m fs - sample rate for output (Hz) T - total duration of output waveform Output: u - waveform samples of the shock time series
member.returns: An MWArray containing the first output argument.

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.ts_arons(MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray)
member.summary: Provides a single output, 1-input MWArrayinterface to the ts_arons M-function.
member.remarks: M-Documentation: TS_ARONS - compute the time history of an explosives generated shock wave Calling sequence: Inputs: z - charge depth in m w - charge weight in kg R - range in m fs - sample rate for output (Hz) T - total duration of output waveform Output: u - waveform samples of the shock time series
member.returns: An MWArray containing the first output argument.

member.remarks: M-Documentation: TS_ARONS - compute the time history of an explosives generated shock wave Calling sequence: Inputs: z - charge depth in m w - charge weight in kg R - range in m fs - sample rate for output (Hz) T - total duration of output waveform Output: u - waveform samples of the shock time series
member.returns: An MWArray containing the first output argument.

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.ts_arons(MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray,MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray,MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray)
member.summary: Provides a single output, 3-input MWArrayinterface to the ts_arons M-function.
member.remarks: M-Documentation: TS_ARONS - compute the time history of an explosives generated shock wave Calling sequence: Inputs: z - charge depth in m w - charge weight in kg R - range in m fs - sample rate for output (Hz) T - total duration of output waveform Output: u - waveform samples of the shock time series
member.returns: An MWArray containing the first output argument.

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.ts_arons(MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray,MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray,MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray,MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray)

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.ts_arons(System.Int32,MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray[]@,MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray[])
member.summary: Provides an interface for the ts_arons function in which the input and output arguments are specified as an array of MWArrays.
member.remarks: This method will allocate and return by reference the output argument array. M-Documentation: TS_ARONS - compute the time history of an explosives generated shock wave Calling sequence: Inputs: z - charge depth in m w - charge weight in kg R - range in m fs - sample rate for output (Hz) T - total duration of output waveform Output: u - waveform samples of the shock time series
member.param: The number of output arguments to return

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.ts_chapman
member.summary: Provides a single output, 0-input MWArrayinterface to the ts_chapman M-function.
member.remarks: M-Documentation: Author: Gopu Potty Organization: University of Rhode Island Date Function: Explosive source model to simulate the pressure time history for a high explosive (e.g. TNT) charge. The primary reference is: Chapman, JASA v78, no 2, 1985, p672-681 Calling sequence: Inputs: z - charge depth in m w - charge weight in kg R - range in m fs - sample rate for output (Hz) T - total duration of output waveform Output: u - waveform samples of the shock time series
member.returns: An MWArray containing the first output argument.

member.name: M:BellhopNL.NLDelaySum.WaitForFiguresToDie
member.summary: This method will cause a MATLAB figure window to behave as a modal dialog box. The method will not return until all the figure windows associated with this component have been closed.
member.remarks: An application should only call this method when required to keep the MATLAB figure window from disappearing. Other techniques, such as calling Console.ReadLine() from the application should be considered where possible.
